citation.article-title: Gaetbulibacter saemankumensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from a tidal flat sediment in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Gaetbulibacter (Gaet.bu.li.bacâ€²ter. N.L. n. gaetbulum -i gaetbul, the Korean name for a tidal flat; N.L. masc. n. bacter from Gr. neut. n. baktron rod; N.L. masc. n. Gaetbulibacter rod isolated from a tidal flat).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative, non-flagellated, non-spore-forming and rod-shaped.
Growth also occurs under anaerobic conditions on MA and on MA with nitrate.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae.
The type species is Gaetbulibacter saemankumensis.
